data.title: Internet
data.text: If you ask for the password, they have free 10 Mbps WiFi. My teenage granddaughters love this place.

data.title: I love Lucy!
data.text:
We love Lucy's Pizza for take out. They've been great to us, even driving a bit out of their way to deliver to us from time to time. Tonight, we decided to try them for dining in for the first time, though after reading other reviews about the slow service, we were a little trepidatious. After all, we had a slightly unruly toddler who skipped her nap with us. I'm pleased to report though, that we had great service from our server, to the gentleman up front who turned on a specific football game for my husband and son. Definitely not fast food, but good food rarely is, and it wasn't overly long. 

Our pizza was fabulous, as always, and reasonably priced. The Meaty is my favorite, with quality sausage being paramount. We also love the BBQ Chicken, though we add bacon. If the breadsticks and cheese bread were better, they'd have earned 5 circles from us. We hope to see it more crowded next time we come in. I'd hate to see great pizza like this leave the Orem area because not enough people appreciate it!

data.title: Felt forgotten in the back ground
data.text: Pizza was alright, but the customer service really turned us off. Employees were more interested in hanging out then serving us.  We had to keep asking for everything ( parmesan, napkins, sauce, drink refills, to go box) got old fast. Felt forgotten by the staff when the place was nearly empty.

data.title: HORRIBLE PLACE - DO NOT ORDER!!
data.text: HORRIBLE PLACE - DO NOT ORDER!!! We ordered dinner from this place and we were told it would be 40 minutes. An hour and a half later the pizza wasn't here. We called back and they said it would be another 45 minutes minimum. Nobody called to tell us that they had lied and it was a 2-hour delivery time. This happens all the time. NEVER ORDER FROM THIS AWFUL PLACE!!!

data.title: Hope you get the right waiter....
data.text: Great pizza service is hit or miss.  I love their pizza but the last time I was there it took them 45 freaking minutes to get it to our table. Not a word from the waiter while we were deciding whether we should just get up and walk out. The only reason we stayed is because the pizza is really good. Ridiculous....

data.title: Greatest NY Pizza in the West - but with one caveat....
data.text:
By far the greatest pizza that you will find west of the Mississippi.  I moved out west from NY and have been on a quest for NY pizza for the last 30 years.  I finally came upon it a couple of years ago.  They only get a 5 "circle?" rating because of the food.

They do have one problem, that I believe they are making an honest effort to correct. You will read other reviews about how poor the service is.  I was one that left a poor review on Facebook one day.  The service was NOTORIOUSLY horrible, but I noticed a significant effort to up their dining game.

To-Go is probably still your best bet if you are in a hurry.  The restaurant would benefit greatly if they would just give up the full-service and just let your order at the counter and take your food back to a table.

Tuesdays is $1.50 slice day and every other day they have a 2 slice and soda special for $6.  Salads are great, appetizers (except for the fried mozzarella brick) are good.  Desserts are OK... They sound great on the menu, but we've never had a winning dessert.

Pizza selection is outstanding, you can't go wrong with any selection.  For the most part our pizza's have always been presentable and edible, on the off occasion you'll get a torn crust of lopsided cut.

data.title: Thin crust pizza and fresh made salads.
data.text: We love the salads at Lucy's. They bring you a little plate with pickles and olives when they bring your drinks. The pizza is thin crust and the slices are huge. They get busy on the weekends so you may have a little wait. Some of the servers are better or more attentive than others but that's not uncommon. We like the food.

owner_response.author: Geoff P, Owner at Lucy's Pizzeria, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thanks for taking the time to leave us the review and feedback.  Have a great 4th of July!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Okay pizza, pretty bad service
data.text: We were seated pretty quickly and had a fine time ordering. Our water was never refilled and they messed up my order. I order a calzone with red sauce on the inside, a preparation method on their menu. When I notified the server I was informed, "we don't do that here." I mentioned it was on the menu and my concern was not addressed. When I got my bill, there was a charge for extra cheese, which I did not order. The food was good, I'd give it a 4 rating based on that, but the service was definitely a 2. Split that and I give this location a solid 3. I don't anticipate being a return customer unless it's to go.

owner_response.author: Geoff P, Owner at Lucy's Pizzeria, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Macabus, sorry to hear that your expectations were turned away.  The server should have realized what you were talking about and gotten it promptly.  We've had an overhaul with the serving staff and are proud of what we are offering and know you will be taking care of.  Hope to see you soon, have a great 4th of July!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: NY Style Pizza
data.text: Pizza was good.  Service lacked a little, but not bad.  We had the pepperoni pizza and enjoyed it.  We went for lunch it wasn't busy, maybe two or three other tables.  Would go back.

data.title: Try the CCB pizza!
data.text:
Great Pizzas!  Great Cheesesticks!  Great Salad! 
Service can be a little slow but the food is worth the wait.  The Margarita pizza is a great choice along with the CCB (Chicken, Bacon, ranch).  Their house salad is super yummy.  
It's definitely one of the best places for pizzas in the city.

data.title: Wow!! This is the best pizza I may have ever had..
data.text: I had take out, the "meaty" pizza. Good quality ingredients and lots of meat. The restaurant was casual and inviting. I would eat in too. You can't go wrong here. If trip advisor says they are closed on Friday that's an error. They are closed on Sunday. Bo appetit!!

owner_response.author: Geoff P, Owner at Lucy's Pizzeria, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you, I will definitely look into our hours of operations.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Okay Pizza
data.text: We were surrounded by traffic to the football game, so we decided to order in. Lucy's was one of the area restaurants that would deliver to our hotel. They delivered in good time and the cost was reasonable. The pizza was a bit soggy in the middle and the crust had gotten a bit too brown. It was still ok, but definitely not the best I have eaten. Also, if you're calling in, be sure to ask for napkins--we had to use Kleenex from the hotel. Still grateful we didn't have to fight the traffic.

owner_response.author: Geoff P, Owner at Lucy's Pizzeria, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thanks for giving us a shot on your busy night.  We appreciate your business.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Best Pizza in Orem
data.text:
The pizza is absolutely amazing. I usually just live on Little Squeezers alone, but once I had Lucy's, I can barely stomach any other pizza. It is incredible.

Also, if you get the chance, ask for Mason to be your server. He is the most attentive and fun waiter we have ever had. He knows how to treat guests and is an asset to the entire city of Orem.

owner_response.author: Geoff P, Owner at Lucy's Pizzeria, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Pete, thanks for taking the time to leave us a review.  We agree, we can barely stomach everyone else too!  I will be sure to pass this on to Mason, he will be excited!
owner_response.title: Owner Response
